lines.text: Quite a large party, isn't it?
Would you like to meet anyone?
No.
It's not very appetizing. It's Victor's birthday. Once a year his friends crawl out of the woodwork.
[Sarcastically]
This year it's a SURPRISE party!
[Lights cigarette]
Will he be surprised to see you?

[He takes her hand with the lit match]
I like matches. You never have to refill them...
[He pulls her hand toward him to light his own cigartte]
... and when you're through with them, you simply throw them away...
[He blows out the match]
... like people.

His day of reckoning must come. He is tormented by fear that someday he will make one false move, one slip that will betray him, and when he does, the lightning of justice will strike... the unsuspected.

[sarcastically to Mathilda]
You look as though you'd been fished out of several oceans!
The nicest thing about guests is their departure
You don't look like you could deny yourself anything
I generally get what I want
Victor's the only man who can turn my blood to ice water.
After slaving all day over a hot typewriter, there's nothing I like better than a swan dive into a bottle of bourbon.

[Remarking about Mathilda]
If that's a Brazilian gown, I'll leave for Argentina in the morning.

[noticing Steve's interest in the portrait of Mathilda]
You seem interested.
Fascinated. You know, it's very much like Montreux in his middle period. Who painted it?
My husband... in his sober period... before he married me.

[Gazing out of window]
It's much too nice a day for murder.
What's wrong, Victor? You've lost all your zip. You're as limp as an old girdle.

[to an arguing Althea and Oliver]
I think you better excuse me. I detest scenes not of my own making. You know, the more I see of marriage, the more thankful I am to be the last of a long line of bachelors.
15 train in the morning!

[sarcastically to Mathilda]
May I suggest you take a very hot bath!

[to Press]
Don't come here again. I'll call you if I need you. In your place I rather enjoy playing God.

[Noticing Steve for the first time]
Are you a late guest from the party or an early arrival for breakfast?

[after listening to Steve's story]
Extraordinary, most extraordinary, but, you know, I didn't believe a word he said.
It sounded too much like the truth to be true.
